remarks: For an initial object, the identity arrow is the one and only morphism of the object to the object itself.  (Contributed by AV, 6-Apr-2020.)
statement:
isinitoi.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
isinitoi.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
isinitoi.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
initoid $p |- ( ( ph /\ O e. ( InitO ` C ) ) -> ( O H O ) = { ( ( Id ` C ) ` O ) } ) $.
